meanings.definition: To throw or toss something upwards.
meanings.sent1: I uphurl the ball into the air.
meanings.sent2: She likes to uphurl the frisbee high in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician uphurled the scarf, making it disappear into the clouds.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to uphurl from deep within his belly.
meanings.sent5: The rocket uphurled into space, leaving a trail of smoke behind.

meanings.definition: To rise or move upwards with force.
meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon slowly uphurled into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The bubbles uphurled from the fizzy drink.
meanings.sent3: The kite uphurled suddenly, surprising the children.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits uphurled when she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The elevator uphurled to the top floor, jolting slightly as it stopped.
